menu2.name: BSI (Bearer Settings Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBSI is used to configure the parameters for GSM/GPRS/LTE data connection.

menu3.Description: Access point name.
The user name of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
The password of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
Backup access point name.
The user name of backup APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
The password of backup APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Auto (LTE & GSM)|1: GSM Only|3: LTE Only|
menu3.Description: Note: GSM means EGPRS here

menu2.name: SRI (Server Registration Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSRI is used to configure how to report all the messages, including the server information and the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal. If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9:MQTT mode|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority|2: High priority |
menu3.Description: If the buffer report function is enabled and the device goes into areas without network coverage, it will store all reports locally. If the device goes into areas with network coverage again, it will then send all the buffered reports.
The IP address or the domain name of the main server.
The port number of the main server.
The IP address or the domain name of the backup server.
The port number of the backup server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable SACK And Check|2: Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK message when receiving a message from the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: ASCII|1: HEX|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the format of the report messages sent from the device to the backend server.
This parameter defines whether to reply with the ACK confirmation via SMS when the command is sent via SMS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: AES-256 includes IMEI|2: AES-256 not include IMEI.
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the message encryption method.

menu2.name: QSS (Quick Start Settings)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTQSS is used to configure GPRS and backend server parameters if the length of all the settings is less than 160 bytes. Otherwise, the two commands AT+GTBSI and AT+GTSRI are used to set those parameters.

menu3.Description: Access point name.
The user name of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.
The password of APN. It must only contain visible ASCII characters, and the commas and dollar signs are not allowed.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9:MQTT mode|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority |2: High priority|
menu3.Description: If the buffer report function is enabled and the device goes into areas without network coverage, it will store all reports locally. If the device goes into areas with network coverage again, it will then send all the buffered reports.
The IP address or the domain name of the main server.
The port number of the main server.
The IP address or the domain name of the backup server.
The port number of the backup server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable SACK And Check|2: Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK message when receiving a message from the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: ASCII|1: HEX|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the format of the report messages sent from the device to the backend server.
This parameter defines whether to reply with the ACK confirmation via SMS when the command is sent via SMS.
The address of primary DNS server.
The address of secondary DNS server.

menu2.name: MQT ( MQTT Server Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMQT is used to configure the username and password to connect to the MQTT server and to subscribe to topics and publish topics, If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the MQTT server.

menu3.Description: It is used to set keep alive mechanism for MQTT. It is a time interval measured in minutes. In particular, 0 means the keep alive mechanism is disabled.
If the MQTT server uses authentication, the username is specified here.
If the MQTT server uses authentication, the password is specified here.
The client subscribes to topic name.
The client publishes topic name.

Each client connected to the server has a unique client identifier (Client ID). Both the client and the server must use the Client ID to identify the state associated with the MQTT session between them. The Client ID can contain only uppercase letters, lowercase letters and numeric characters.

menu2.name: OWL (Operator List Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWL is used to configure a white or forbidden list of operators to allow GPRS connection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: White list Mode|2: Black List Mode|

menu3.Description: A white list of PLMN codes for network operators. The PLMN code comprises of mobile country code MCC and mobile network code MNC, each of which consists of 3 digits. The last digit of MNC can be omitted, for example, 46001F or 46001 represents the PLMN of CHINA UNICOM.
The timeout period for the terminal to establish connection to the TCP server.

menu2.name: FTP (FTP Server Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFTP is used to configure the FTP server information as to where and how to upload data packets. If the device is configured correctly and <Server Type> of AT+GTCMS is set to 1, it will be able to transfer data packets to FTP server.

menu3.Description: The IP address or the domain name of the FTP server.
The server port of the FTP server.
The file path to save pictures. To restore the default path after a path is set, set it to “\”.
The user name to login to the FTP server.
The password to login to the FTP server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Passive mode.|1: Active mode.|
menu3.Description: The mode of transferring file.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Breakpoint Continuation Mode|1: Retransmission Mode|
menu3.Description: The mode of transferring picture after transfer fails.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Whether to report +RESP:GTFTP to the backend server after transferring a file.
The file name prefix of transformed file. It should not include “.”.

menu2.name: MSI (Multi Server Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMSI is used to configure where and how to report all the messages, including the server information and the communication method between the backend server and the terminal. When the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 2: The Data Server of MSI
0: Stop mode.|2: TCP short-connection forced mode.|3: TCP long-connection mode.|4: UDP mode. |6: UDP with fixed local port.|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the communication method between the backend server and the terminal.
The IP address or the domain name of the primary server.
The port number of the primary server.
The interval for sending heartbeat package message (+ACK:GTHBD) when report mode is TCP long-connection mode or UDP mode. If it is set to 0, no heartbeat package message will be sent.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable SACK And Check|2: Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK messages when receiving messages from the terminal.

menu2.name: TLS (TLS Data Encryption)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTLS is used to configure TLS encryption parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The Data Server of SRI|
menu3.Description: The index of the Server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Do not verify the certificates|1: Only server certification|2: Two-way certification
menu3.Description: It specifies the certificate verification method for the terminal.

menu2.name: CFG (Global Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCFG command is used to configure global parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the odograph by GNSS|2: Enable the odograph by GNSS and CAN Module|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the odograph function to calculate the total mileage.
The initial value for calculating the total mileage.

menu3.RangeMx: Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Mileage|Send Time|Device Name|
menu3.Description: Bitwise report mask to configure the composition of report message.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: GNSS Deep Saving Mode|2: GNSS Low Saving Mode|
menu3.Description: Set mode of power saving function.

menu3.RangeMx: GNSS Satellite Number|Reserved|
menu3.Description: A bitwise numeral to control whether to include the corresponding fields in each position after <Cell ID>
Bitwise mask to configure which event message should be sent to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Each time the device powers on, all LEDs will work for 30 minutes and then be off|1: All LEDs will be turned on as configured|2: All LEDs will work 10 minutes after the device is powered on and then will be off|
menu3.Description: 0: Each time the device powers on, all LEDs will work for 30 minutes and then be off|1: All LEDs will be turned on as configured|2: All LEDs will work 10 minutes after the device is powered on and then will be off|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable unit information report function.
Reporting interval for sending unit information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Ignore SMS location request.|1: Report the current position to server.|2: Report the Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|&0: Hang up only.|1: Report the current position to server.|2: Report the Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|3: Both 1 And 2|
menu3.Description: Location Request Mask High Bit' Text='4 high bits for SMS request.' 'Location Request Mask Low Bits' Text='l 4 low bits for how to handle the incoming call if <Mode> in AT+GTMON is not 2 or 3.'

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable backup battery.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Charge On Need|1: Charge After Ignition On|
menu3.Description: 0: If the main power supply is connected, the backup battery is charged as needed.|1: If the main power supply is connected, the backup battery is only charged when ignition on is detected. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: AGPS Offline|2: AGPS Online|
menu3.Description: A numeric to indicate whether to enable AGPS.

menu3.RangeMx: 00: Do not allow the cell information report.|40: Allow the cell information report after failing to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|80: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM after getting GNSS position successfully every time if cell information is available.|C0: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM no matter whether it is successful to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|&+RESP:GTRTL|+RESP:GTLBC|+RESP:GTFRI / +RESP:GTERI|+RESP:GTSOS|+RESP:GTTOW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
menu3.Description: GSM Report' Text='Control how or when to report cells’information' 'GSM Report' Text='Bitwise mask to configure which event report should be sent to the backend server.'
A time parameter to monitor the GNSS signal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: GPS and GLONASS|1: GPS|4: GPS and BeiDou|12:GPS, Galileo and BeiDou|14:GPS, GLONASS, Galileo and BeiDou|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the watchdog function.

menu2.name: DOG (Protocol Watchdog)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOG command is used to reboot the device in a time based manner or upon ignition. This helps the device avoid working in an abnormal state for a long time. Besides these two automatic reboot methods, the device also supports the use of the digital input to trigger the reboot manually.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Reboot Periodically|2: Ignition Reboot|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the watchdog function.
The time at which the reboot operation is performed when <Interval> condition is met.
The interval for rebooting the device. It is measured in days. Rebooting the device for the first time will ignore this interval.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: The interval for rebooting the device when the device is unable to be registered on the EGPRS/LTE network. 0 means “Do not reboot the device”.
The length of time (in minutes) before rebooting the device when the device fails to send a message. 0 means “Do not reboot the device”.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Reboot System|1: Reboot RF Module|
menu3.Description: It is used to set the category that needs to be rebooted.

menu2.name: GAM (GNSS-Assisted Motion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGAM is used for assisting in measuring motion with GNSS if the sensor detects stationary state while the vehicle is ignition on.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the use of GNSS speed to assist with motion status measurement based on motion sensor state.
The speed threshold which is combined with GNSS speed to measure the status of movement.
If the average speed is higher than <Motion Speed Threshold> for <Motion Cumulative Time>, the device is considered to be in moving state.
If the average speed is lower than <Motion Speed Threshold> for <Motionless Cumulative Time>, the device is considered to be in stationary state.
If the time of GNSS fix is more than <GNSS Fix Failure Timeout>, the device will update motion status by motion sensor. There may be a maximum error of 4 seconds.

menu2.name: HMC (Hour Meter Count)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHMC is used to measure the accumulated use time of the device with each actuation of ignition on. To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device.

menu3.Description: Initial hours meter count

menu2.name: HRM (Hex Report Mask)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTHRM command is used to control the composition of the corresponding HEX report message. In each HEX report message, the corresponding mask for the report indicates which part is reported.

menu3.RangeMx: Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|Reserved
menu3.Description: Component mask of the acknowledgement received.

menu3.RangeMx: Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|MCC/MNC/LAC/Cell ID/Reserved|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Supply Voltage|Analog Input Mode|Analog Input1 Voltage|Analog Input2 Voltage|Reserved|Digital IO Status|Motion Status|Satellite Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|RFID|CAN Data|EIO100 IO Status|RFID Length|Reserved|Reserved|Analog Input3 Voltage|Reserved
menu3.Description: Component mask of the location report message.

menu3.RangeMx: |Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|MCC/MNC/LAC/Cell ID/Reserved|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Supply Voltage|Analog Input Mode|Analog Input1 Voltage|Analog Input2 Voltage|Reserved|Digital IO Status|Motion Status|Satellite Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|RFID|CAN Data|EIO100 IO Status|RFID Length|Reserved|Reserved|Analog Input3 Voltage|Reserved
menu3.Description: Component mask of the event report message.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number|INF Expansion Mask|+RESP:GTVER|+RESP:GTIOS|+RESP:GTGPS|+RESP:GTBAT|+RESP:GTCID|+RESP:GTCSQ|+RESP:GTTMZ|+RESP:GTGSM
menu3.Description: Component mask of the information report message. Bit 0 - Bit 15 indicate which groups of information items are included when the device reports the message INF (HEX).

menu3.RangeMx: +RESP:GTGSV|+RESP:GTUVN|+RESP:GTCVN|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTCML|Reserved|+RESP:GTWRT|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTSCS|+RESP:GTCIF|+RESP:GTRSV|INF Expansion2 Mask|
menu3.Description: Bit 16 - Bit 31 of <+INF Mask>, component mask of the expand information report. Each bit indicates which expand information is included when the device reports the message +RESP:GTINF.

menu3.RangeMx: Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTBSV|+RESP:GTTVN|Network Type|
menu3.Description: Bit 32 - Bit-47 of <+INF Mask>, component mask of the expand information report. Each bit indicates which expand information is included when the device reports the message +RESP:GTINF.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|UID
menu3.Description: Component mask of the heartbeat data.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|
menu3.Description: Component mask of the data report message.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number
menu3.Description: Component mask of the crash data packet.

menu3.RangeMx: |Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|MCC/MNC/LAC/Cell ID/Reserved|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version
menu3.Description: Component mask of the CANBUS Information packet in HEX format.

menu2.name: OWH (Outside Working Hours)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWH is used to define the working hours and the working mode to protect the privacy.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Manual Start Mode|2: Full Manual Mode|3: Automatic Mode|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable|1: Manual start mode. By connecting an external unit to a specified digital input of the device, the driver manually enables time check.|2: Full manual mode. By connecting an external unit to a specified digital input of the device, the driver has full control of the privacy protection.|3: Automatic mode. In this mode, the device will ignore the status of the digital input. It will automatically check the current time against the working hours range.|
It specifies the working days in a week in a bitwise manner.
The first period of working hours in a day.
The first period of working hours in a day.
The second period of working hours in a day.
The second period of working hours in a day.

menu2.name: PDS (Preserving Device's States)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPDS is used to preserve specified logic states for the device. The function works according to the <Mode> setting, and the logic state(s) to be saved are selected according to the value of <Mask>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Save Logical States.|2: Reset Logical States.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function.|1: Preserve specified logic state(s) of the device according to the value of <Mask>.| 2: Reset all the specified logic states listed in <Mask> after receiving the command, and then preserve the specified logic states according to the value of <Mask>.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: States of GEO|1: Reserved|2: Reserved|3: Information of last known position|4: State of ignition|5: State of wave shape 1|6: State of digital input|7: State of SPD|8: State of SSR|9: State of main power|10: State of PEO|11: Reserved|12: Reserved|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the device state to be preserved.

menu2.name: PIN (Auto-unlock PIN)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPIN is used to configure the auto-unlock PIN function of the device.

menu3.Description: The code used to unlock the SIM PIN.

menu2.name: TMA (Time Adjustment)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTMA is used to adjust for the local time of the device remotely. Upon receiving this command, the device will set the time zone and daylight saving accordingly. Then it will use the given UTC time to adjust for the local time based on the time zone and daylight saving setting.

menu3.Description: It indicates the positive or negative offset of the local time from UTC time.
A numeral to indicate whether to check GNSS UTC time with network time.

menu2.name: WLT (Allowlist)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTWLT is used to configure a list of authorized phone numbers which are allowed to perform the SMS functions.

menu3.RangeMx: White list for location by call.|Reserved.|White list for SMS.|
menu3.Description: Bit0: White list for location by call.|Bit1: Reserved.|Bit2: White list for SMS. Gateway number and SOS number will ignore the white list function.|

menu3.RangeMx: 10: Number|20|||

menu2.name: AVS (Accelerometer Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAVS is used to configure parameters for detecting virtual ignition status based on motion status. It works when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Accelerometer (motion status) virtual ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: A time parameter to determine whether the device enters stationary state.
A time parameter to determine whether the device enters moving state.

menu2.name: VVS (Voltage Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVVS is used to configure parameters for checking ignition state by voltage. It will work when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Voltage Virtual Ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: The external power voltage in ignition on state.
The offset from <Ignition On Voltage> used to determine ignition on or ignition off state.
The debounce time before updating virtual ignition state according to the external power voltage.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the smart voltage adjustment algorithm. The values of <Ignition On Voltage> and <Voltage Offset> will keep static.|1: Enable the smart voltage adjustment algorithm. The values of <Ignition On Voltage> and <Voltage Offset> will dynamically change according to the actual ignition on and off voltage.|
The debounce time to wait before updating the virtual ignition off state according to the external power voltage.

menu2.name: VMS (Virtual Ignition Mode Selection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVMS is used to configure the mode of virtual ignition state detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|2: Voltage virtual ignition detection mode. |4: Accelerometer virtual ignition detection mode.|7: Combined detection mode. |
menu3.Description: A numeral to define the working mode of virtual ignition state detection.

menu3.RangeMx: Voltage virtual ignition detection|Motion status virtual ignition detection|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to detect the ignition on event.

menu3.RangeMx: Voltage virtual ignition detection|Motion status virtual ignition detection|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to detect ignition off event.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: AND logic.|1: OR logic.|
menu3.Description: The logic of each bit in <Virtual Ignition On Mask>.

menu2.name: CMD (Command String Storage)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCMD command is used to store the commands which will be used by the command AT+GTUDF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete command.|1: Add command.|

menu2.name: UDF (User Defined Function)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUDF command is used to bind input events and stored commands. The input events will trigger the corresponding stored commands.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable The Event Group.|1: Enable The Event Group|2: Delete The Event Group|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the user defined function.
A numeral to identify the group of input events and stored commands to be executed.

menu3.RangeMx: Power on finished|Ignition on|Ignition off|Attached to the GPRS network|Not attached to the GPRS network|Registered on GSM network|Not registered on GSM network|Network roaming|Network non-roaming|SIM card is locked|GNSS is on|GNSS is off|The device is stationary|The device is moving|External charge inserted|No external charge|The device is charging|The device is not charging|Digital input 2 is enabled|Digital input 2 is disabled|Digital input 1 is enabled|Digital input 1 is disabled|SIM card is inserted|SIM card is not inserted|Reserved|Reserved|Inside the speed range|Outside the speed range|Messages need to be sent|No messages need to be sent|Digital input 3 is enabled|Digital input 3 is disabled|Backup battery inserted|No backup battery|No change of SIM card|SIM card change|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Driver authorized|Driver unauthorized|Reserved|Reserved|The device is located successfully|The device is located failure|Connected to the data server successfully|Disconnected from the data server|
menu3.Description: The bitwise mask to indicate the input events included in the group.
The debounce time for input events before the specified stored commands are executed.

menu3.RangeMx: Inside the Geo 0|Inside the Geo 1|Inside the Geo 2|Inside the Geo 3|Inside the Geo 4|Inside the Geo 5|Inside the Geo 6|Inside the Geo 7|Inside the Geo 8|Inside the Geo 9|Inside the Geo 10|Inside the Geo 11|Inside the Geo 12|Inside the Geo 13|Inside the Geo 14|Inside the Geo 15|Inside the Geo 16|Inside the Geo 17|Inside the Geo 18|Inside the Geo 19|

Outside the Geo 0|Outside the Geo 1|Outside the Geo 2|Outside the Geo 3|Outside the Geo 4|Outside the Geo 5|Outside the Geo 6|Outside the Geo 7|Outside the Geo 8|Outside the Geo 9|Outside the Geo 10|Outside the Geo 11|Outside the Geo 12|Outside the Geo 13|Outside the Geo 14|Outside the Geo 15|Outside the Geo 16|Outside the Geo 17|Outside the Geo 18|Outside the Geo 19|

Stocmd ID Mask 0|Stocmd ID Mask 1|Stocmd ID Mask 2|Stocmd ID Mask 3|Stocmd ID Mask 4|Stocmd ID Mask 5|Stocmd ID Mask 6|Stocmd ID Mask 7|Stocmd ID Mask 8|Stocmd ID Mask 9|Stocmd ID Mask 10|Stocmd ID Mask 11|Stocmd ID Mask 12|Stocmd ID Mask 13|Stocmd ID Mask 14|Stocmd ID Mask 15|Stocmd ID Mask 16|Stocmd ID Mask 17|Stocmd ID Mask 18|Stocmd ID Mask 19|Stocmd ID Mask 20|Stocmd ID Mask 21|Stocmd ID Mask 22|Stocmd ID Mask 23|Stocmd ID Mask 24|Stocmd ID Mask 25|Stocmd ID Mask 26|Stocmd ID Mask 27|Stocmd ID Mask 28|Stocmd ID Mask 29|Stocmd ID Mask 30|Stocmd ID Mask 31|
menu3.Description: Note: The maximum number of the stored commands to be excuted in a group is five.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Do not send an acknowledgement message when a stored command is executed.|1: Send an acknowledgement message when a stored command is executed.|

menu3.RangeMx: Inside the Peo 0|Inside the Peo 1|Inside the Peo 2|Inside the Peo 3|Inside the Peo 4|Inside the Peo 5|Inside the Peo 6|Inside the Peo 7|Inside the Peo 8|Inside the Peo 9|Inside the Peo 10|Inside the Peo 11|Inside the Peo 12|Inside the Peo 13|Inside the Peo 14|Inside the Peo 15|Inside the Peo 16|Inside the Peo 17|Inside the Peo 18|Inside the Peo 19|

Outside the Peo 0|Outside the Peo 1|Outside the Peo 2|Outside the Peo 3|Outside the Peo 4|Outside the Peo 5|Outside the Peo 6|Outside the Peo 7|Outside the Peo 8|Outside the Peo 9|Outside the Peo 10|Outside the Peo 11|Outside the Peo 12|Outside the Peo 13|Outside the Peo 14|Outside the Peo 15|Outside the Peo 16|Outside the Peo 17|Outside the Peo 18|Outside the Peo 19|

menu2.name: ASC (Axis Self-Calibration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTASC is used to define the condition for calibrating the directions of accelerometer. When the auto self-calibration factors updated, the device will report the event message ASC which includes the calibration result to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the +RESP:GTASC report.

menu2.name: BTS (Bluetooth Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBTS is used to configure Bluetooth settings for the device to report certain events.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Non-discoverable mode|1: General Discoverable After Igintion On|2:General Discoverable After Igintion Off|3:General Discoverable After Power On|
menu3.Description: 0: Non-discoverable mode|1: General discoverable mode: The device will remain discoverable for <Discoverable Time> minutes after the ignition is turned on|2: General discoverable mode: The device will remain discoverable for <Discoverable Time> minutes after the ignition is turned off|3: General discoverable mode: The device will remain discoverable for <Discoverable Time> minutes after it is powered on|
The mode to configure the Bluetooth to be non-discoverable or discoverable for the period according to <Discoverable Time>.

menu3.RangeMx: Name|MAC Address|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Peer Role|Reserved|Peer Address Type|Peer MAC Address|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of Bluetooth information in report messages.
Bitwise mask to configure which event report should be sent to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: Frequency of scanning.
The duration of each scan.

menu2.name: BAS (Bluetooth Accessory)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBAS is used for the device to scan or connect with Bluetooth accessories in order to obtain data such as humidity, temperature or fuel level. To use this command, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be enabled.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No Bluetooth accessory|1: Escort Bluetooth Accessory|2: Beacon temperature sensor|6: Beacon Multi-Functional Sensorr|7: Technoton accessory|8: External Input Output Bluetooth Accessory|10: Mechatronics Bluetooth accessory|11: Magnet Bluetooth accessory|12: BLE TPMS sensor|13: Relay Bluetooth accessory|15: Movement-Angle BLE Sensor
menu3.Description: The type of the Bluetooth accessory which is defined in the <Index>.
The model of the Bluetooth accessory which is selected in the <Accessory Type>.

menu3.RangeMx: Accessory Name|Accessory MAC|Accessory Status|Accessory Battery Level|Accessory Temperature|Accessory Humidity|Reserved|Accessory Input Output Data|Accessory Event Notification Data|Tire pressure|Timestamp|Enhanced Temperature|Magnet Data|Accessory Battery Percentage|Relay Data|Expansion Mask| Tri-axial Acceleration Data|Angle Values|Senosr Event Mask|MOV ELA Data|Reserved|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of Bluetooth accessary info.
The interval for reading data from Bluetooth accessory.
Specify the lower limit voltage. When the voltage of Bluetooth accessary is below this value, the device will report message +RESP:GTBAA to backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable event notification.|1: Enable event notification.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable event notification.|1: Enable event notification. If a new event occurs on the accessory, the device will report the message +RESP:GTBAA.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable temperature alarm.|1: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is within the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|2: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is outside the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|3: Report temperature alarm only once if the current temperature enters or exits the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>. |
If the sensor detects that the ambient temperature meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable temperature alarm.|1: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is within the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|2: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is outside the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|3: Report temperature alarm only once if the current temperature enters or exits the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|
If the sensor detects that the ambient temperature meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report humidity alarm within the humidity range.|2: Report humidity alarm outside the humidity range.|3: Report humidity alarm only onceenters or exits the humidity range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable humidity alarm.|1: Report humidity alarm if the current humidity is within the humidity range defined by <Low Humidity> and <High Humidity>.|2: Report humidity alarm if the current humidity is outside the humidity range defined by <Low Humidity> and <High Humidity>.|3: Report humidity alarm only once if the current humidity enters or exits the humidity range defined by <Low Humidity> and <High Humidity>. |
If the sensor detects that the ambient humidity meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the humidity.
The actual length of sensor after cutting.
The frequency of empty sensor (not immersed in fuel).
The frequency of sensor fully immersed in fuel.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The original value of fuel level.|1: The percentage of fuel level.|
menu3.Description: The format of fuel level in the message.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable mag event notification.|1: Enable mag event notification. If a new event occurs on the accessory, the device will report the message +RESP:GTBAA.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report tire pressure alarm within the tire pressure range.|2: Report tire pressure alarm outside the tire pressure range.|3: Report tire pressure alarm only once enters/exits the tire pressure range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable tire pressure alarm.|1: Report tire pressure alarm if the current tire pressure is within the tire pressure range defined by <Low Tire Pressure> and <High Tire Pressure>.|2: Report tire pressure alarm if the current tire pressure is outside the tire pressure range defined by <Low Tire Pressure> and <High Tire Pressure>.|3: Report tire pressure alarm only once if the current tire pressure enters/exits the tire pressure range defined by <Low Tire Pressure> and <High Tire Pressure>. |
If the tire pressure keeps meeting the alarm condition for <Validity> times, the tire pressure alarm will be triggered.
After the <Validity> checking, the device will report tire pressure alarm every <Alarm Send Interval> times of tire pressure reading based on reading timer of the tire pressure sensor.
If the device does not detect the tire pressure sensor in the <Available Validity Time>, the <Accessory Status> in the message +RESP:GTERI report messages will be 0.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable realy event notification function.

menu2.name: BID (Bluetooth Beacon ID)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBID is used for the device to scan Bluetooth beacon accessories. To use this function, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be 1.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: WKF300|1: iBeacon E6|2: ID ELA|4: WID310|
Reserved|Accessory MAC|Reserved|Accessory Battery Level|Reserved|Reserved|Signal Strength|Beacon Type and Beacon Data|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of the Bluetooth accessory information in +RESP:GTBAA and +RESP:GTBID messages.
It specifies the lower voltage limit.
The expand number of <Organization Unique Identifier>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:No push the WKF300|1:Push the WKF300|
menu3.Description: If this parameter is set to 1 and the button on WKF300 is pushed, the device will report the message +RESP:GTBAA to backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable Keyfob detection.|1: Allow the device to scan only once.After entering ignition on and moving state|2: Allow the device to scan continuously.After entering ignition on and moving state.|5: Allow the device to scan continuously.After entering ignition on|
menu3.Description: 0:Disable Keyfob detection.|1: Enable Keyfob detection: Allow the device to scan only once. After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will scan Keyfobs one time for the time period specified by <Keyfob Detection Interval> and then will send the message +RESP:GTBID to report information of Keyfob(s). If more than 3 Keyfobs are detected, the message +RESP:GTBID contains information of top 3 Keyfobs with the strongest signal.|2: Enable Keyfob detection: Allow the device to scan continuously. After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning Keyfobs continuously. If the device detects Keyfob(s) or change of available Keyfob(s), it will send the message +RESP:GTBID to report information of Keyfob(s). If more than 3 Keyfobs are detected, the message +RESP:GTBID contains information of top 3 Keyfobs with the strongest signal.|5: Enable Keyfob detection: Allow the device to scan continuously. After entering ignition on, the device will send the +RESP:GTBID message to report information of Keyfob(s) if it detects Keyfob(s) or change of available Keyfob(s) within <Keyfob Detection Interval> time. If more than 3 Keyfobs are detected, the +RESP:GTBID message contains information of the top 3 Keyfobs with the strongest signal.|
The device scans Keyfob for the time period specified by this parameter.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable detection.|1: Allow the device to scan only once. After entering ignition on and moving state.|2: Allow the device to scan continuously. After entering ignition on and moving state.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable detection.|1: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan only once. After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will scan E6 one time for the time period specified by <E6 Detect Interval> and then it will send the message +RESP:GTBID to report information of E6. If more than 15 iBeacon E6 are detected, the message +RESP:GTBID contains the information about the top 15 iBeacon E6.|2: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan continuously. After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning E6 continuously. If the device detects E6 or change of available E6, it will send the message +RESP:GTBID to report information of E6. If more than 15 iBeacon E6 are detected, the message +RESP:GTBID contains the information of the top 15 iBeacon E6.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable alarm.|1: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast.|2: Alarm when Bluetooth broadcast is not received.|3: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast or leaving Bluetooth broadcast.|

0: Disable detection.|1: Allow the device to scan only once.After entering ignition on and moving state|2: Allow the device to scan continuously. After entering ignition on and moving state|3: Allow the device to scan continuously.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable detection.|l 1: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan only once. After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will scan IDELA one time for the time period specified by <IDELA Detect Interval> and then it will send the message +RESP:GTBID to report information of IDELA. If more than 15 IDELA are detected, the message +RESP:GTBID contains the information about the top 15 IDELA.|2: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan continuously. After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning IDELA continuously. If the device detects IDELA or change of available IDELA, it will send the message +RESP:GTBID to report information of IDELA. If more than 15 IDELA are detected, the message +RESP:GTBID contains the information of the top 15 IDELA.|3: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan continuously. If the device detects IDELA or change of available IDELA, it will send the message +RESP:GTBID to report information of IDELA. If more than 15 IDELA are detected, the message +RESP:GTBID contains the information of the top 15 IDELA.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|2: Allow the device to scan continuously. After entering ignition-on-and-moving state|3: Allow the device to scan continuously. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable.|2: Enable detection:After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID310 continuously. |3: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan continuously. The +RESP:GTBID message is sent to the backend server periodically according to the parameter <WID310 IGN Report Interval>/<WID310 IGF Report Interval>. |
It is the first three bytes of Bluetooth address, which is composed of NAP and UAP.

menu2.name: AEX (Analog Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAEX is used to configure the parameters of External Bluetooth Analog Input accessories. All these inputs are customizable.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Bluetooth Analog Input accessory setting|
0: Disable|1: Enable Analog Input Alarm Within The Range|2: Enable Analog Input Alarm Outside The Range|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable|1: Enable analog input alarm: If the current input voltage is within the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|2: Enable analog input alarm: If the current input voltage is outside the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|

menu2.name: BTD(Bluetooth Accessory Data)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBTD is used for the device to report message +RESP:GTBTD to the backend server.

menu3.Description: It is used to bind the specific configuration in AT+GTBAS.

menu3.RangeMx: Accessory Name|Accessory MAC|Accessory Status|Accessory Battery Level|Accessory Temperature|Enhanced Temperature|Tri-axial Acceleration Data|Angle Values|Senosr Event Mask|
menu3.Description: This mask is used to configure the accessory data fields to be reported in the +RESP:GTBTD messages.

menu2.name: FRI (Fixed Report Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFRI is used to configure the parameters for fixed report FRI or ERI.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Fixed Time Report.|2: Fixed Distance Report. |3: Fixed Mileage Report. |4: Optimum Report.|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function.|1: Fixed Time Report. The position report message is sent to the backend server periodically according to the parameter <Send Interval>.|2: Fixed Distance Report. |3: Fixed Mileage Report. |4: Optimum Report. The device simultaneously checks both time interval and path length between two adjacent position reports.|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report. It checks either time interval or path length between two adjacent reports.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Enable.|1: Disable.|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable report when there is no GNSS fix.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|

menu3.Description: The threshold to determine whether unit is turning around a corner.

menu3.RangeMx: Digital Fuel Sensor Data|1-Wire Data|CAN Data|Percentage|Volume|Reserved|Reserved|RF433 Accessory Data|Bluetooth Accessory Data|Reserved|Fuel Temperature|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|RAT and Band Data|
menu3.Description: Used to configure whether to report the data from peripherals by +RESP:GTERI.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not wrap corner point|1: Wrap corner point and wait|
menu3.Description: 0: Do not wrap corner point and send the corner point immediately when it is found.|1: Wrap corner point and wait until the condition to send +RESP:GTFRI reaches according to the value of <Mode>|

menu2.name: FFC (Frequency Change of FRI)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFFC is used to change the parameters of fixed report when a certain event occurs, so that different report interval requirements can be met. When the event disappears, the device will resume its previous settings.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Change FRI parameters By Geo-Fence Alarm|2: Change FRI parameters By Know Roaming Alarm|3: Change FRI parameters By Unknow Roaming Alarm|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the parameters of the specified priority|1: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into any of the defined Geo-Fence|2: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into known roaming state. (Please refer to the AT+GTRMD command for more information.)|3: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into unknown roaming state.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Fixed Distance Report|3: Fixed Mileage Report|4: Optimum Report|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report|
menu3.Description: 0: Do not change the working mode|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Change the working mode to “Fixed Distance Report”|3: Change the working mode to “Fixed Mileage Report”|4: Change the working mode to “Optimum Report”|5: Change the working mode to “Fixed Time or Mileage Report”|

menu2.name: CRA (Crash Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCRA is used to configure the parameters for crash detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Detection Of Crash With Three-Axis|2: Enable Detection Of Crash With Self-calibration Three-Axis|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable|1: In this mode, three-axis self-calibration is not needed.|2: In this mode, the acceleration sensor data will be converted in accordance with three-axis self-calibration (Please refer to AT+GTASC for detailed information). |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Start Sampling After power on|1: Start Sampling After ignition on|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate when to start acceleration sampling.
Pick out all day of work The number of XYZ-axis acceleration samples recorded before crash.
The number of XYZ-axis acceleration samples recorded after crash.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates whether to report the acceleration data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates whether to report the GNSS information of 10s before crash and 10s after crash to the backend server.
The debounce time for crash event to avoid accidental triggering.

menu2.name: BZA (Buzzer Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set buzzer alarm. There are four kinds of alarms. Each alarm outputs a different sound with the buzzer, and all the alarms are settable in this command. Before those alarms are used, the output ID which connects with the buzzer should be configured and enabled.

menu2.name: DUC (Data Usage Consumption)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDUC is used to get statistics about data usage.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function and clear the statistics of data usage.|1: Enable this function of data usage statistics.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Month|1: Year|
menu3.Description: 0:The device will clear the statistics and restart to calculate data usage every month|1:The device will clear the statistics and restart to calculate data usage every year|
The maximum data usage allowed in the <Statistical Period>.
The +RESP:GTDUC will be reported when the total data usage reaches the level specified by this parameter.
The +RESP:GTDUC will be reported when the daily data usage reaches the level specified by this parameter.

menu2.name: GEO (Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGEO is used to configure the parameters of circular Geo-Fence. Circular Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated. .

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the zone’s circular Geo-Fence function|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the zone’s circular Geo-Fence function.|1: Entering the zone. The device will send the report +RESP:GTGIN to the server when it detects that vehicle enters the Geo-Fence area.|2: Exiting the zone. The device will send the report +RESP:GTGOT to the server when it detects that vehicle exits the Geo-Fence area.|3: Report the +RESP:GTGIN and +RESP:GTGOT when entering and exiting the Geo-Fence zone respectively.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable auto trigger mode|21: Auto parking fence. |22: Manual parking fence|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable auto trigger mode.|21: Auto parking fence. Automatically set up Geo-Fence after ignition off. |22: Manual parking fence. Manually enable Geo-Fence after ignition off. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Whether to report +RESP:GTGES message when the specified trigger mode is triggered and when the Geo-Fence is cancelled.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Report upon getting the state for the first time.|1: Do not report until the state changes.|
menu3.Description: The mode of state reporting.

menu2.name: PEO (Polygon Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPEO is used to configure the parameters of Polygon Geo-Fence. Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo-fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the zone’s Geo-Fence function.|1: Entering the zone. The +RESP:GTGIN message will be generated only when the terminal enters the Geo-Fence.|2: Exiting the zone. The +RESP:GTGOT message will be generated only when the terminal exits from the Geo-Fence.|3: Report the +RESP:GTGIN and +RESP:GTGOT when entering and exiting the Geo-Fence zone respectively.|

menu2.name: PEG (Polygon Geo-Fence Group)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPEG is used to configure the groups of Polygon Geo-Fence.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|

menu2.name: HBM (Harsh Behavior Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHBM is used to monitor the harsh driving behavior based on GNSS or motion sensor.The same harsh behavior within 30 seconds will only be reported once if only GNSS is used to measure harsh driving behavior.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Detected by GNSS only|2: Detected by motion sensor only|3: Detected by motion sensor or GNSS|4: Detected by motion sensor and GNSS|5: Detected by XYZ-axis acceleration data only|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function.|1: Enable this function: Detection by GNSS only.|2: Enable this function: Detection by motion sensor only.|3: Enable this function: Detection by motion sensor or GNSS.|4: Enable this function: Detection by motion sensor and GNSS.|5: Enable this function: Detection by XYZ-axis acceleration data only.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not discard unknown harsh behavior message|1: Discard unknown harsh behavior message|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to discard the +RESP:GTHBM message that indicates unknown harsh behavior.
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is in harsh cornering or harsh braking state.
A time parameter to measure whether the device enters harsh cornering or harsh braking state.
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is in harsh accelerate behavior statu
The time parameter to confirm that the device enters harsh accelerate status.
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is in harsh turn or harsh break status.
The time parameter to confirm that the device enters harsh turn or harsh break status.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the report +RESP:GTHBE, only report +RESP:GTHBM|1: Enable the report +RESP:GTHBE, and report +RESP:GTHBM|2: Enable the report +RESP:GTHBE, do not report +RESP:GTHBM|
menu3.Description: Whether to report +RESP:GTHBE/+RESP:GTHBM to the backend server.

menu2.name: IDL (Excessive Idling Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDL is used to detect the engine excessive idling (vehicle stays stationary while ignition is on). To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device. If the vehicle is entering into/leaves the idle status, the device will report the event message IDN/IDF to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: If the vehicle is detected to be stationary with ignition on for this time long, it is considered to be in idling status.
The time of the vehicle is considered to leave idling status.
After entering the idle state, if the vehicle moves more than <Debounce Distance>, it is considered to exit the idle state.

menu2.name: JBS (Jamming Behavior Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJBS is used for the Jamming Behavior.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Jamming Behavior Setting Configure Mode.|2: Jamming Behavior Setting Reset Mode.

menu3.Description: It specifies the length of time the siren is on.
It specifies the length of time the siren is off.
It indicates the length of time when the fuel is cut off and whether jamming state is checked every 2 seconds is determined according to the <Check Jamming in T3>.
Whether to check speed when the device enters jamming state.
The speed limit to cut off fuel.
It is used to set the initial state of output 1.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable motion sensor.|1: Enable motion sensor.|
menu3.Description: Whether the motion sensor needs to measure the motion state to cut off fuel when the GNSS fix failure timeout expires.
It indicates the time length of GNSS timeout.
It defines whether to control siren with digital output 2 in the current JBS state.
If the device enters into JBS and then cuts off fuel, it will check the current jamming state when the <Fuel Cut-off Timer (T3)> condition is met.
It indicates whether the JBS state machine starts T3 timer to check jamming state and starts T6 timer if the device quits jamming state.
It indicates the length of time to be waited before releasing fuel and quitting JBS state machine.

menu2.name: JDC (Jamming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJDC is used to configure the parameters for jamming detection. When the detection condition is matched, the device will report the event message JDR/JDS to the backend server according to the <Mode> setting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report the +RESP:GTJDR message upon entering into jamming state.|2: Report the +RESP:GTJDS messageupon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable jamming detection function.|1: Enable jamming detection function. If jamming is detected, the device will report the +RESP:GTJDR message upon entering into jamming state.|2: Enable jamming detection function. If jamming is detected, the device will report the +RESP:GTJDS message upon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state.|
The built-in LTE jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
The built-in LTE jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
The built-in 2G jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
The built-in 2G jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
When the device detects jamming, it will trigger the “enter jamming” event based on the <Enter Jamming Timer Threshold>.
When the device quits jamming, it will trigger the “quit jamming” event based on the <Quit Jamming Timer Threshold>.

menu2.name: RMD (Roaming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRMD is used to configure the parameters for roaming detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: The index range of the white list from which code are to be updated.
The index range of the white list to which code are to be updated.
Do not set same code nubmeras any one in another list.
The index range of the white list from which code are to be updated.
The index range of the white list to which code are to be updated.
Do not set same code nubmeras any one in another list.
The index range of the list from which code are to be updated.
The index range of the list to which code are to be updated.
Do not set same code nubmeras any one in another list.
Bitwise mask to configure which event message should be sent in known roaming status.
Bitwise mask to configure which event message should be sent in unknown roaming status.

menu2.name: SIM (Binding SIM Card)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTSIM command is used to bind SIM card function. If the current SIM card is replaced by another SIM card, then the digital output will be triggered.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not bind SIM card|1: Bind the current SIM card|2: Bind the specified SIM card by ICCID|

menu2.name: SOS (SOS Setting)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure a specified input port for emergency. When an emergency occurs, the end user can use the specified input port to trigger the emergency call and report the position message SOS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable SOS function|2: Send the current position to the backend server only|4: Send the current position to the SMS gateway via SMS|
1: Send The Current GNSS Location|2: Send The Last GNSS Location|3: Both Mode 1 And 2|

menu2.name: SPA (Overspeed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set the speed thresholds and bind one alarm type with each speed threshold for the buzzer alarm. If the current speed meets one of the thresholds, the buzzer will make a sound corresponding to the alarm type.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: Strict Standard Mode|2: Warning mode|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable|1: Strict standard mode. In this mode, the device will check the speed and trigger the buzzer alarm during speedup or slowdown.|2: Warning mode. In this mode, the device will only check the speed and trigger the buzzer alarm during speedup.|

menu2.name: SPD (Speed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a speed range for the speed alarm function of the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal could report the message SPD to the backend server when its moving speed is outside or inside the range.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable speed alarm|1: Alarm in speed range|2: Alarm out of speed range|3: Report Speed Alarm Only once if the current speed enters or exits the speed range|4: Report speed alarm if the current speed enters or exits the speed range|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable speed alarm|1: Report speed alarm if the current speed enters the speed range specified by <Min Speed> and <Max Speed>|2: Report speed alarm if the current speed exits the speed range specified by <Min Speed> and <Max Speed>|3: Report speed alarm only once if the current speed enters or exits the speed range specified by <Min Speed> and <Max Speed>|4: Report speed alarm if the speed enters or exits the speed range. But the backend server will not receive the +RESP:GTSPD message for speed exiting from the speed range unless it has received the alarm for speed entering the speed range first| |

menu2.name: SSR (Start/Stop Report)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSSR is used to detect the status of vehicle (Start/Stop status). When it is detected by the device that the vehicle is entering into Start/Stop status, the device will report the event message STR/STP to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: After the vehicle enters into start status, if it rest again and keeps in that status for this time long, \nthe vehicle is considered to leave start status.
If the vehicle is detected to be moving with ignition on for this time long, it is considered to be in start status
The start speed threshold to determine whether the vehicle is start or not.
After the vehicle enters into stop status and stay stop for this time long.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Minute|1: Second|
menu3.Description: It controls the time unit of <Time to Stop>and<Time to Start> parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The event message +RESP:GTSTP will be reported when the engine is turned off and the time meets the parameter <Time to Stop>|1: The event message +RESP:GTSTP will be reported immediately when the engine is turned off, it only works when <Mode> is set to 1
menu3.Description: Whether to report +RESP:GTSTP message immediately when the engine is turned off.

menu2.name: Tow (Tow Alarm)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTOW command is used to configure the tow alarm parameters.

menu3.Description: A duration threshold to judge whether the moving terminal is considered being towed after its engine off.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit with engine off is in fake tow after it changes to move from stillness.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit enters stillness status.
A duration threshold to judge whether unit enters motion status.
The threshold for on-board motion sensor to judge whether unit is moving.

menu2.name: AIS (Analog Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAIS is used to configure the parameters of analog input ports.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable analog input alarm|1: Enable analog input alarm(the current input voltage is within the range)|2: Enable analog input alarm(the current input voltage is outside the range)|3: Connect with fuel sensor|4: No alarm mode. |5: Processed voltage mode|6:Enable analog input alarm(the current input voltage enters or exits the range) |7: Enable analog input alarm(the current input voltage enters or exits the range,the alarm will be triggered, but the backend server will not receive )|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable analog input alarm.|1: Enable analog input alarm. If the current input voltage enters the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|2: Enable analog input alarm. If the current input voltage exits the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|3: Connect with special fuel level sensor to support fuel level reporting and monitoring.Note: When the selected mode is 3, please do not choose the waveform 1 as the specified output waveform.|4: No alarm mode. The range of the voltage will be ignored and no alarm will be triggered.|5: Processed voltage mode. The range of the voltage will be ignored and no alarm will be triggered. However, the voltage will be processed before being reported.|6:Enable analog input alarm. If the current input voltage enters or exits the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered. |7:Enable analog input alarm. If the current input voltage enters or exits the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered, but the backend server will not receive the analog input alarm for the current input voltage exits the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>) unless it has received the alarm for the current input voltage enters the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>)|
The sampling period of the analog input port.
The number of square-wave generated from output port.
The device can send the analog input voltage periodically along with fixed report message. Set this field to 1 to enable it, 0 to disable.

If the difference between the current fuel level after ignition on and the last measured fuel level \n before the previous ignition off is greater than this value, an unusual fuel consumption alarm \n is sent with event message +RESP:GTFLA.

This parameter will use with <Min Threshold>and <Max Threshold>parameters together,it express that the voltage margin error of the <Min Threshold>and <Max Threshold>parameters, if the current value of voltage detection include in the voltage margin error of the min and max threshold, this voltage value will not be processed.

If the value of IGF Fuel Update is 1, the fuel level will be updated in real time in the +RESP:GTFRI after the device detects ignition off. If the value of IGF Fuel Update is 0, the fuel level will not be updated in real time, but will be updated when the device detects fuel loss alarm.

menu2.name: DIS (Digital Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDIS is used to configure the parameters of 4 digital input ports. The input <Ignition Detection> is dedicated to ignition detection. The other three inputs are customizable. If the logic status is changed on one of the three digital input ports, the device will report the message DIS to the backend server.

menu3.Description: The validity time of the input port. 0 means “Do not check the validity time”.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Send Real Time Position|1: Send Last Know Position|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to include real time position or last known position in the report +RESP:GTDIS.

menu2.name: DOS (Digital Output Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOS command is used to output specified wave shape from the digital output ports. A total of four wave shapes are supported as shown below. If set to wave shape 1, the device will maintain this wave shape at the specified output port after power reset.

menu3.Description: A numerical to indicate the version of this command.
The number of output ports which are going to be set.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable status.|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-wave-shape Enable status|
0: Disable status|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-wave-shape Enable status|
0: Disable status|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-wave-shape Enable status|
0: Disable status|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-wave-shape Enable status|
0: Disable status|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-wave-shape Enable status|

For output 1 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For output 2 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For output 3 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For output 4 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For output 5 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|
menu3.Description: Whether or not to report +RESP:GTDOS when the status of wave shape 1 output changes.
Digital output will not be triggered when GNSS speed exceeds the set speed.

menu2.name: EPS (External Power Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEPS is used to configure the parameters for external power supply monitoring. The device will measure and monitor the voltage of the external power supply. If the voltage of the external power supply meets the predefined alarm condition, the device will report an alarm message EPS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable |1: Report when the input voltage in the range|2: Report when the input voltage outside the range|3: Report when the input voltage inside or outside the range|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the external power supply monitoring function.|1: Enable the external power supply monitoring function. If the current voltage is within the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the +RESP:GTEPS alarm will be triggered.|2: Enable the external power supply monitoring function. If the current voltage is outside the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the +RESP:GTEPS alarm will be triggered.|3:If the current voltage is within the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>) or outside the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the +RESP:GTEPS alarm will be triggered.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not report external power supply voltage|1: Report external power supply voltage|
menu3.Description: Besides the +RESP:GTEPS alarm report, the device can also send the voltage of external power supply periodically along with the fixed report message.

This parameter will use with <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters together,it express that the voltage margin error of the <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters, if the current value of voltage detection include in the voltage margin error of the min and max threshold, this voltage value will not be processed.

This parameter will be used with <Debounce Time> together, if the voltage drops or bursts exceptionally greater than <Debounce Voltage Threshold>, the device will start to debounce voltage by <Debounce Time>.
The validity time of detecting the device connecting or disconnecting main power supply, 0 means not to check the validity time.

menu2.name: GDO (Gradual Digital Output)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTGDO command is used to configure specified gradual progressive wave shape from the digital output ports.

menu3.Description: Time (in units of 100ms) that the output will be in active state, during the first cycle.
Time (in units of 100ms) that forms a complete cycle (ON phase time + OFF phase time).
Time (in units of 100ms) that shall be added to the ON phase time, before starting the next cycle. If this time is 0, the cycles are kept equal.

menu2.name: IOB (Input/Output Binding)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure the user defined output-port actions triggered by input ports. If the I/O binding is configured and the corresponding condition is met, the device will output specified wave shape on the specified output port.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|Digital input 3|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|EIO100 input 9|EIO100 input A|EIO100 input B|EIO100 input C|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask for the combination of input ports.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|Digital input 3|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|EIO100 input 9|EIO100 input A|EIO100 input B|EIO100 input C|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask for the combination of trigger conditions from combined input ports.
The sample period to check status of all combined digital input ports within one IO binding.

menu2.name: CDA (Configuration of DR100 Accessory)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCDA is used for setting DR100 accessory.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not check prefix string, and output card ID directly.|1: Do not check prefix string, and output card memory data directly.|2: Check prefix string with card memory data and output card ID.|3: Check prefix string with card memory data and output card memory data.|
menu3.Description: It configures the mode of DR100 reading card data.
It specifies which block of DR100 memory will be used to save the card key.
It is used as card key for checking.

menu2.name: CMS (Camera Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCMS command is used for setting camera parameters.

menu3.Description: The compression ratio of picture. Pictures’ quality would be better with smaller compression ratio.

menu3.RangeMx: Camera ID|Photo Time|
0: Backend Server|1: FTP Server|
0: ASCII|1: HEX|
menu3.Description: Whether to pack picture data by +RESP:GTEHD instead of +RESP:GTPHD in HEX format.

menu2.name: TAP (Take-Picture)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTAP command is used for real-time photographing.

menu2.name: DAT (Transparent Data)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDAT is used to transfer data between the backend server and the accessories connected to the second serial port of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Send message to the backend server with +RESP:GTDAT (Short Format).|1: Send the pure data directly to the serial port.|2: Send message to the backend server with +RESP:GTDAT (Long Format).|3: Send the pure data directly to the serial port without CRLF.|4: Send the pure data directly to the Bluetooth.|5: Send the pure data directly to the Bluetooth without CRLF.|
0: Do not need the ACK report|1: Need the ACK report|
menu3.Description: Whether to report +ACK:GTDAT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: ASCII|1: HEX|
menu3.Description: If this parameter is set to 1, <Data> will be converted to hex format before sent to the serial port. This parameter is valid only when the <Command Type> is 1 or 3.

menu2.name: TKS (TPT2 Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTKS command is used to query some base information like data, hour, GNSS fix, GPRS connection status and others through RS232.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Short information type.|2: Long information type.|
menu3.Description: 1: Short information type. In this type, the device will send <GNSS Accuracy>, <GPRS Signal>, <Digital Inputs> and <Digital Outputs> to TPT2 through RS232.|2: Long information type. In this type, the device will not only send <GNSS Accuracy>, <GPRS Signal>, <Digital Inputs> and <Digital Outputs> and other information to TPT2 through RS232.|

menu2.name: EFS (External Digital Fuel Sensor)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEFS is used to configure the parameters of the external digital fuel sensor. If <Working Mode> in AT+GTURT is set to 4, the parameters of this command are used.

menu3.Description: The value get form the sensor when the fuel tank is full.

If the difference between the current fuel level after ignition on and the last measured fuel \nlevel before the previous ignition off is greater than this value, an unusual fuel consumption alarm \nis sent with event message +RESP:GTFLA, and 0 means to disable this function.
If enable, the GV300 device will not send command to the fuel sensor, \nand the sensor must be set as periodical data output
If ' Ex Unsolicited Enable ' is disable, the GV300 device will send READ \ncommand to the fuel sensor and read the data as this frequency.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No filter|1: 12 seconds|2: 24 seconds|3: 36 seconds|4: 60 seconds|5: 120 seconds|6: 180 seconds|7: 240 seconds|8: 480 seconds|9: 960 seconds|
menu3.Description: The filter factor of the sensor and now only QFS100 can use this factor, and for other sensors, this parameter is ignored.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not report raw data from fuel sensor|1: Report raw data from fuel sensor|
menu3.Description: A numeric to indicate whether to report raw data from fuel sensor to the backend server with +RESP:GTFSD.
If <Unsolicited Enable Ex> is disabled, the device will send READ command to the fuel sensor.
The count of readings of fuel level used for fuel alarm detection after ignition on.
0 means' Disable this function'.

menu2.name: FSC (Fuel Sensor Calibration)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set the calibration table for fuel sensor.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EPSILON ES2 or ES4|1: LLS 20160|2: DUT-E|3: QFS100|4: UFSxxx|5:Reserved|6: DUT-E SUM|20: ADC1|21: ADC2|22: ADC3|

menu3.Description: Enable/disable the table. If this table is disabled, the calculation of fuel level will be linearized.

menu2.name: IDA (ID Authentication)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDA is used to protect against unauthorized use. This is achieved through an ID card reader for driver identification, and connecting an external relay (normally closed relay recommended) to cut off the starter or the fuel pump.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Only authorized ID cards can unlock the vehicle.|2: Any ID card can unlock the vehicle.|

menu3.Description: Timeout after Ignition off Mode.

menu3.RangeMx: Report the ID which is authorized.|Report the ID which is unauthorized.|Report the ID which has logged out.|

menu3.Description: It will remain authorized for this period of time when the ID is validity.
It only works when <Mode> is set to 1 and <ID List Type> is set to 0.
It specifies the output port to indicate the target ID is waiting for authorization.
It specifies the timeout period for authorization.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Report the latest RFID number after getting the card ID|1: Report the latest RFID number when the ignition is turned on and the card is authorized, or the ignition is turned off and the timeout period specified by <Timeout after Ignition Off> |2:Report the latest RFID number when in an authorized state.|
menu3.Description: 0: Report the latest RFID number after getting the card ID.|1: Report the latest RFID number when the ignition is turned on and the card is authorized, or the ignition is turned off and the timeout period specified by <Timeout after Ignition Off> is not reached.|2: Report the latest RFID number when in an authorized state(except message +RESP:GTIDA).

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Use <IDA Number List> in the command AT+GTIDA|1: Use <MAC List> and <Organization Unique Identifier> in the command AT+GTBID

menu2.name: IDC (ID Check)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDC is sent to the device through the server. It is used to delete or verify the authorization status of the target ID.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Target ID is not authorized by the server.|1: Target ID has been authorized by the server.|2: Delete target ID locally.|
menu3.Description: Note: The delete operation is only used to delete the target ID. If the target ID is in an authorized state, the authorization operation will not be revoked immediately before the end of authorization.

menu2.name: TTR (Transparent THR_100 Transmission)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTTR is used to transfer data between the backend server and the terminal that connects with THR_100 via the second serial port. Data to the backend server is wrapped into the message TTR and sent to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: DDD file request.|1: Send authorization APDU to the device. |2: DDD file request cancel. Cancel the older request.|3: Debug mode. Read the state of THR_100. Please do not send this command during the interaction of DDD file.|4: To restart TachoReader manually.|5: Inquiry Tachograph model.|6: Inquiry status of the device.|7: Inquiry Tachograph driver 1 id, name and surname.|8: Inquiry special status.|9: Remote start the long press. After sending it, there will be corresponding effect on the LED.|
menu3.Description: Note: Please do not issue the query command when requesting DDD file.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Through the message +RESP:GTTRD.|1: Through FTP, and the command AT+GTFTP should be set.|
Request to read TACHOGRAPH memory.|Request to read driver card in slot 1.|Request to read driver card in slot 2.|

menu3.Description: Note: If <Start Time> and <End Time> are set to the future time, the memory of the Tachograph will be read from the date of the last reading.
The serial number of reply APDU, it should keep the same as that sent from the terminal to server.
It is the APDU DATA for TACHOREADER.

menu2.name: UDT (User-defined Data Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUDT is used to transfer data to the serial port or Bluetooth of the device. Data to the serial port or Bluetooth is wrapped into the message +RESP:GTUDT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable the data transfer.|1:Enable the data transfer to the serial port.|2:Enable data transfer to Bluetooth.|

menu3.Description: Period to send the related information when the ignition is on.
Enable to send the related information when the ignition is off

menu3.RangeMx: for activated GEO|for activated PEO|

Protocol Version, Firmware Version|Hardware Version|Unique ID|Device Name|Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|MCC, MNC, LAC, Cell ID, Position Append Mask|Mileage|HMC|GSV|GEO State|Analog Input|Digital Input, Motion Status|External Power VCC, Backup Battery Level, Charging|GEO Status Mask|PEO State|PEO Status Mask|Reserved|Send Time|

menu2.name: UFS (UFSxxx FOTA Upgrade)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUFS is used to upgrade the firmware in UFSxxx fuel sensor over the air.

menu3.Description: It specifies the maximum time of retries to download the update package upon download failure.
It specifies the expiration timeout of one download. If the download expires, it is considered to be failure.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
