menu3.Description: The protocol used to download the package.
If the file server uses authentication, the user name is specified here.
If the file server uses authentication, the password is specified here.
It specifies the URL to download the package.

menu2.name: URT (Serial Port Setting)
menu2.Description2: The serial port of the device is used to connect with external devices to extend the application of the device. The command AT+GTURT is used to configure the working mode of the serial port for different external devices and the parameters for the serial port communication.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable UART|1: Use UART to transfer data via AT+GTDAT and other protocol commands |3: Used for specific RFID card reader to communicate with UART of the terminal|4: Used for digital fuel sensor|6: Used for transfer data when receive a special byte|7: Used for transparent transfer encapsulated in hexadecimal code|8: Used for transparent transfer encapsulated in pure HEX code|9: Used for Camera.|14: Used for transferring specified reports via satellite terminal when GSM is not available.|20: Used for sending out NMEA sentences|22: Used for WRT100 accessory|24: Used for THR_100.|28: Used for Communication with TPT2|41: Used for the TPM (Tire Pressure Monitoring), the device will report the tire data to the server with the report +RESP:GTTPM.|

menu3.Description: The index of the supported baudrate of the serial port.

menu3.RangeMx: 7:7bits data|8:8bits data
menu3.Description: Data Bits of the UART and its’ value may be 7 and 8.

menu3.RangeMx: 1:1 Stop bit|2:2 Stop bits|3:1.5 Stop bits
menu3.Description: Stop Bits of the UART and its’ value may be 0, 1 and 2.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: None parity|1: Odd parity|2: Even parity|
menu3.Description: Parity Bits of the UART and its’ value may be 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the device sleep mode and enable auto online mode.|1: Enable the device sleep mode and enable auto online mode.|2: Disable the device sleep mode and disable auto online mode.|3: Enable the device sleep mode and disable auto online mode.|
menu3.Description: The device support the sleep mode to reduce the power consumption.

menu3.RangeMx: 2: MR2. 9600 baud rate, 8 data bits, 1 stop bit and no parity.|3: VD RFID. 9600 baud rate, 8 data bits, 1 stop bit and no parity.|4: DR100. 19200 baud rate, 8 data bits, 1 stop bit and no parity.|
menu3.Description: The type of RFID connected with serial port.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EPSILON ES2 or ES4|1: LLS 20160|2: DUT-E|3: QFS100|4: UFSxxx|5: Reserved.|6: DUT-E SUM|
menu3.Description: The type of digit fuel sensor connects with serial port.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Short format|1: Long format|

menu3.Description: When auxiliary serial port receives this character, data in front of.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Short format|1: Long format|
0: Short format|1: Long format|
0: Terminal does not check SACK.|1: The terminal will check the SACK and if it fails, it will resend the message up to three times.

menu3.Description: 1 means ST2100
Bitwise mask to configure the composition of report messages
The bitwise mask to configure whether to output the specific NMEA sentence.

menu2.name: WRT (RF433 Accessory)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTWRT is used to configure the parameters for RF433 accessories.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Wireless temperature sensor (WTS100)|1: Wireless temperature & humidity sensor (WTH100)|

menu3.Description: o set the sample interval. The range is 0|3-255 and the unit is 10s.
The count of accessories.
The time for pairing accessory.

menu2.name: ACD (1-Wire Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTACD is used to configure the parameters of 1-Wire devices which include iButton/DR200 and temperature sensor.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EIO100 is not connected with 1-wire.|1: EIO100 is connected with 1-wire.|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether EIO100 is connected with 1-wire.
If the value of this parameter is 0, the device will not report the +RESP:GTFRT message.

menu2.name: IEX (Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIEX is used to configure the parameters of four EIO100 inputs. All these four inputs are customizable. If the logic status is changed on one of the EIO100 input ports, the device will report the message DIS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EIO100 Setting.|1: Bluetooth Accessory Input Setting.|

menu3.Description: It is used to bind the specific configuration in AT+GTBAS when the <Input Expansion Type> is set to 1. And it will be ignored if the <Input Expansion Type> is 0.
The total number of configured EIO100 inputs.

menu2.name: OEX (Output Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTOEX command is used to output wave shape 1 on EIO100 output. To use this function, please set the <EIO100 Connection> in AT+GTACD to 1 for EIO100 device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: EIO100 Setting.|1: Bluetooth Accessory Input Setting.|

menu3.Description: It is used to indicate how many of the following special parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: For EIO100 output 9 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For EIO100 output A (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For EIO100 output B (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For EIO100 output C (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|
menu3.Description: Whether or not to report +RESP:GTDOS when wave shape 1 status of EIO100 output changes or Bluetooth Output changes.

menu2.name: TMP (Temperature Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a temperature-alarm range for the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal will report the event message TMP to the backend server when the temperature outside or inside the range is detected by the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the Alarm within the temperature range|2: Enable the Alarm Outside the temperature range|3: Enable the Alarm within or outside the temperature range, But Report only once|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable temperature alarm.|1: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is within the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|2: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is outside the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|3: Report temperature alarm only once if the current temperature enters / exits the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>. |
ID of the temperature sensor

menu2.name: CAN (Canbus Setting)
menu2.Description2: This command AT+GTCAN is used to set the CANBUS device configuration for reporting CANBUS device information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable this function.|1:Enable the CAN chip. In this mode, only CANBUS device information will be reported.|6:Enable the CAN chip. In this mode, the CAN chip will work according to <Machine Model>.|

VIN|Ignition Key|Total Distance|Total Fuel Used|Vehicle Speed|Engine RPM|Engine Coolant Temperature|Fuel Consumption|Fuel Level|Range|Accelerator Pedal Pressure|Total Engine Hours|Total Driving Time|Total Engine Idle Time|Total Idle Fuel Used|Axle Weight 2nd|Tachograph Information|Detailed Information / Indicators|Lights|Doors|Total Vehicle Overspeed Time|Total Vehicle Engine Overspeed Time|Total Distance Impulses|Engine Cold Starts Count|Engine All Starts Count|Engine Starts by Ignition Count|Total Engine Cold Running Time|Handbrake Applies During Ride Count|Electric Report Mask|CAN Report Expansion Mask|GNSS Information|GSM Information|

menu2.name: CLT (Canbus Alarm Setting)

menu2.name: CFU (CAN FOTA Upgrade)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCFU is used to upgrade the firmware in CAN Module over the air.

menu3.Description: It specifies the maximum number of retries to download the update package upon download failure.
It specifies the expiration timeout of one download. If the download expires, it is considered to be a failure.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP.|

menu3.Description: If the file server uses authentication, the user name is specified here.
If the file server uses authentication, the password is specified here.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: CAN Module Firmware update|1: CAN Module configuration update|2: THR_100 update|
0: Start the CAN Module upgrade process.|1: Cancel CAN Module upgrade process.|

menu2.name: CDS(Configuration of DR100 State)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+ GTCDS is used for setting buzzer and LED state of DR100 Card Reader.

menu3.Description: The index of setting method of DR100 Card Reade state.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The ID is unauthorized|1: The ID is authorized|
menu3.Description: It configures the authentication status of DR100 ID.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It configures the output state of DR100 Card Reader Buzzer.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The ID is unauthorized|1: The ID is authorized|
menu3.Description: It configures the output state of Green LED of DR100 Card Reader.

menu2.name: TPM(Tire Pressure Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTPM is used to configure the parameters of tire pressure monitoring system. the message +RESP:GTTMS will be reported to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the tire monitoring function.|1: Fixed Time Report.

menu2.name: FVR (Configuration File Version Record)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFVR is used to record information of the configuration file generated by Manage Tool for AT+GTUPC.

menu3.Description: The version number of the configuration file.
It is used to confirm the validity of subsequent commands.
The version number of the configuration file.

menu2.name: UPC (Update Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUPC command is used to download configuration file over the air for the update of the local configuration.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
0: Disable|1: Enable.|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Report the message +RESP:GTUPC.|1: Report the message +RESP:GTEUC to include more information|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the message to be reported for the configuration update status when <Report Mode> is 1.
A numeral to identify the configuration update request.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition Off|Ignition On|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the status in which the device can update the configuration.

menu2.name: UPD(Firmware Update)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUPD is used to start and stop the firmware update remotely.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Start the Firmware Update|1:Stop the Firmware Update|
0: HTTP.|
0: BB firmware update.|4: BLE firmware update.|5: CAN Module firmware update.|6: UFS xxx fuel sensor update.|9: CAN Module configuration update.|10: THR_100 update
0:Report the +RESP:GTUPD message to indicate the firmware update status.|1:Report the +RESP:GTEUD message to indicate the firmware update status.|

menu2.name: RTO (Real Time Operation)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTO is used to retrieve information from the terminal or control the terminal when it executes certain actions.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Get the GNSS related information|1: RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately |2: Get the current configuration of the terminal.|3: Reboot the terminal.|4: RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings.|5: Power off the device.|6: Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal|7: Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal |8: Get the version information of the device|9: Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal.|A: Get status of all the IO ports.|B: Get the time zone settings |C: Get cell information.|D: Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF|E: Request the device to report the GNSS satellites information via the message +RESP:GTGSV.|10: Get CAN information via the message +RESP:GTCAN.|11: Get the version number information of UFSxxx fuel sensor via the message +RESP:GTUVN|12: Get the version number information of CAN Module via the message +RESP:GTCVN.|16: Get the device state via the message +RESP:GTGTS|1C: Get basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI.|1D: Get DR100 accessory information via the message +RESP:GTQDA.|22: Set car model for CAN Module or read car model from CAN Module.|25: Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS.|27: Set the working mode for the RF433 accessories.|2B: Get the version number information of THR_100 via the message +RESP:GTTVN.|2F: Query the information related to CAN and report them via +RESP:GTCIF message|31: Delete all the buffered reports.|38: Get the statistics of data usage via the message +RESP:GTDUC|3A: Set the state of the WRL300.|3C: TPMS.|
